brief_summary.textblock:
This is a single site, prospective, non-blinded, non-randomized, non-interventional study
      designed to evaluate the effect of changes in alveolar minute ventilation on the measurement
      of respiratory heat loss (enthalpy).

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Alveolar Minute Ventilation on Respiratory Gas Heat Content
clinical_study.condition: Focus: Effect of Ventilation Pattern on Airway Enthalpy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age greater than 18 years

          -  scheduled for an elective surgical procedure with an anticipated duration of more
             than 2 hours requiring general anesthesia and positive pressure ventilation using an
             endotracheal tube

          -  patient status ASA 1, 2 or 3

          -  no significant cardio-vascular or respiratory disease

          -  supine surgical position

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Adults unable to give primary consent

          -  age less than 18 years

          -  pregnancy

          -  prisoners

          -  pre-existing cardiac or pulmonary disease

          -  infusion of inotropic drugs

          -  positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) requirements >8 cm H2O

          -  increased intra-abdominal pressure (e.g. planned surgical pneumoperitoneum or
             ascitis)

          -  intra-operative patient position other than supine

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Alveolar Minute Ventilation on Respiratory Gas Heat Content

primary_outcome.description: This is a single site, prospective, non-blinded, non-randomized, non-interventional study designed to evaluate the effect of changes in alveolar minute ventilation on the measurement of respiratory heat loss (enthalpy) in Joules per minute.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
